author: @shertenator
text: Eddie what are your thoughts on the Uighur situation in China.

replies.author: @MidwesternMarx
replies.text: The anti terrorism efforts have turned Xinjiang into a surveillance state, and the re education schools are ethically questionable. However, the accusations of genocide are manufactured by the US state department, and private entities interested in seeing regime change in China. The US has also been covertly supporting the most extremist elements in the region in an effort to destabilize China.

replies.author: @finn.schttlr
replies.text: @MidwesternMarx Anti terrorism efforts are a part of, but by far not the only reason why people are being interned. The China Cables leaks proved that things as simple as closing your restaurant during Ramadan or growing a beard can lead to you being imprisoned in the camps without trial. I am in no way supporting what the US is trying to do in Xinjiang, but at the same time we should not be so naive and think that the Chinese government only wants to fight terrorism. They want to destroy Islamic culture and the beliefs of the Muslim population in China. While as an Atheist I am not a big fan of many of the teachings of Islam, everyone should be free to believe whatever they want. The Chinese government is destroying this fundamental human right.

replies.author: @meatrace
replies.text: @finn.schttlr I get what you're saying, but I can't really rustle up a fuck to give about Islam. I'm kinda okay with them destroying religious culture. It's no excuse for all the other horrific shit they do on a daily basis to political dissenters of other ilk.
